metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5744 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A failure to free memory can occur when processing messages having a specific combination of EDNS options. Versions affected are: BIND 9.10.7 -> 9.10.8-P1, 9.11.3 -> 9.11.5-P1, 9.12.0 -> 9.12.3-P1, and versions 9.10.7-S1 -> 9.11.5-S3 of BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition. Versions 9.13.0 -> 9.13.6 of the 9.13 development branch are also affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.5').
